body:
Now that `CXXFLAGS` are [back in user control](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/24391), I don't think there's a
reason to no-longer use our warning flags when `CXXFLAGS` has been
overriden (this includes, by default, when building from depends).

Anyone can suppress warnings from third-party code using
`--enable-suppress-external-warnings`, or, passing the relevant `-Wno-`
option in `CXXFLAGS`.

I think a follow up step to this could even be to flip
`suppress-external-warnings` to be on by default. This had been
preposed previously, but iirc was before some of the recent
flag-handling refactors needed to give users back control.

Closes: #18092.
